message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.SI, cs.SD, cs.LG. 

This paper deals with the task of topic classification of tweets, which falls under the domain of natural language processing (NLP). Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also involves information retrieval (IR) techniques for identifying curated streams, which makes cs.IR (Information Retrieval) another likely sub-category. The use of labeled data to train classifiers falls under the domain of supervised learning, which is covered by cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also involves the analysis of large collections of data, which falls under the domain of big data and data mining, covered by cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) and cs.SD (Sound and Music Computing).
